input_text:
Job Title: Project Engineer

Location: Detroit, MI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job DescriptionWe’re looking for a full-time Project Engineer to join our office in Detroit, who is enthusiastic about building engineering and will play a critical role in onboarding buildings into our smart building platform. Our mission is to give our clients the best experience possible, every day. To do that, we depend on our team of talented, ambitious people who share our passion for excellence. 
WHAT YOU WILL DO:  Implement and enable the KODE OS smart building platform at new sites by integrating the technologies available in the building such as HVAC, Lighting, Fire, Indoor Air Quality, IoT and moreWork directly on building systems to ensure correct data availability occursFocus on data normalization and data model of building systems to build a proper structure for each building Utilize detailed analysis of system operations and documentation to assess pertinent diagnostics and insights to be executed for the buildingImplement advanced features that allow for diagnostics and insights into a building’s HVAC/energy/life systems such as reports, visualizations, alarms and functional testsAdvise and assess IT & OT network infrastructures for appropriate system data communicationCollaborate with project managers and clients to provide technical assistance and documentation consisting of above tasks
RequirementsHVAC Controls and/or System Integrator background (3+years of experience preferred)Exposure to software development and data analytics / engineering practicesExperience with direct client interaction and communication to ensure successful product deliveryAbility to handle multiple projects from concept through execution, meeting deadlines without sacrificing qualityExcellent multitasking, attention to detail and organizational skills
GOOD TO HAVE:Commercial real estate project experience Experience in real estate energy consumption and modelingExperience working with building management systems and commercial level HVAC controlsNiagara / BMS Certifications is a plusKnowledge of and experience with industry communication protocols (BACnet, Modbus, LON)Knowledge of IT network infrastructure practices 

BenefitsWHAT WE OFFER: Competitive salary based on experience Discretionary Bonus Program Comprehensive Health Insurance PackageCareer Development Program Dynamic team and challenging projects Flexible Paid Time Off Welcoming and friendly work environment Regular social events and activities 
JOIN THE TEAM: KODE Labs is a real estate technology company founded in 2017 with a mission to change the way people, buildings and systems operate. Headquartered in Detroit, Michigan, we are a driving force behind the adoption of smart building technology. To scale our presence across numerous cities and countries, we depend on our team of talented, ambitious people who go above and beyond to create value for our clients. 
When you join the KODE Labs team you can create your own career. Whether you have years of experience or are just starting, we help you realize your full potential and achieve your goals. 
If KODE Labs sounds like the place for you, we’d love to hear your story, so please apply through our online application form. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Project Engineer
output_json.summary: Join KODE Labs, a real estate technology company, as a full-time Project Engineer in Detroit, MI.
job_responsibilities: Implement and enable the KODE OS smart building platform at new sites
Integrate technologies available in the building
Focus on data normalization and data model
Build proper structure for each building
Utilize detailed analysis of system operations
Execute reports, visualizations, alarms, and functional tests
Advise and assess IT & OT network infrastructures
Collaborate with project managers and clients
output_json.company_information: KODE Labs is a real estate technology company founded in 2017 with a mission to change the way people, buildings, and systems operate. Headquartered in Detroit, Michigan, we are a driving force behind the adoption of smart building technology.
